questions.question: What is a Python library?
choices: A collection of books about Python
A pre-written code collection that extends Python's capabilities
A type of Python data structure
questions.answer: A pre-written code collection that extends Python's capabilities

questions.question: Which command is used to install external libraries in Python?
What does API stand for?
Which library is commonly used for making HTTP requests in Python?
What is the primary purpose of an API?
choices: To allow different software applications to communicate
questions.answer: To allow different software applications to communicate

questions.question: Which data format is commonly used for API responses?
What does JSON stand for?
Which Python library is commonly used for data visualization?
What is the purpose of the 'import' statement in Python?
choices: To include external libraries or modules
To print output to the console
questions.answer: To include external libraries or modules

questions.question: Which HTTP method is typically used to retrieve data from an API?
What is a common use case for APIs in Python programming?
choices: To retrieve data from external services
questions.answer: To retrieve data from external services

questions.question: Which Python module is used to parse JSON data?
What is the typical first step when using an external library in Python?
Which of the following is NOT a common type of API?
What is the purpose of API documentation?
choices: To provide the source code of the API
To explain how to use the API and what endpoints are available
To list all the users of the API
To show the API's performance metrics
questions.answer: To explain how to use the API and what endpoints are available

questions.question: What is an API key typically used for?
choices: To authenticate and authorize API requests
To translate API responses to different languages
questions.answer: To authenticate and authorize API requests

questions.question: Which of the following is a benefit of using libraries in Python?
choices: It makes the code run slower
It saves time by reusing existing code
It makes the code more difficult to understand
questions.answer: It saves time by reusing existing code

questions.question: What is an API endpoint?
choices: The final line of code in an API
A specific URL where an API can be accessed
The last data point returned by an API
questions.answer: A specific URL where an API can be accessed

questions.question: Which of the following is NOT a common HTTP status code?
What does the requests.get() function return?
choices: A string containing the response data
A boolean indicating success or failure

questions.question: Which method is used to extract the content of a response from the requests library?
What is the purpose of the json.loads() function in Python?
choices: To create a new JSON file
To send JSON data to an API
To parse a JSON string into a Python object
questions.answer: To parse a JSON string into a Python object

questions.question: Which of the following is NOT a common type of data visualization?
What is the purpose of the plt.show() function in matplotlib?
choices: To save the plot as an image file

questions.question: Which of the following is a drawback of using external libraries?
What is the purpose of the requests.post() function?
choices: To retrieve data from an API
To send data to an API
To update existing data in an API
To delete data from an API
questions.answer: To send data to an API

questions.question: Which of the following is NOT a common parameter in API requests?
What is the purpose of error handling when working with APIs?
choices: To make the code run faster
To reduce the amount of data returned
To handle unexpected responses or failures gracefully
questions.answer: To handle unexpected responses or failures gracefully

questions.question: Which of the following is a best practice when using API keys?
choices: Hardcoding them in your source code
Sharing them publicly to encourage collaboration
Storing them in environment variables or configuration files
Using the same key for all your projects
questions.answer: Storing them in environment variables or configuration files

questions.question: What is the primary advantage of using JSON for API responses?
choices: It's easy for both humans and machines to read
It's the most secure data format
It's the only format supported by Python
questions.answer: It's easy for both humans and machines to read
